title: Memorials of his time,
author: Cockburn, Henry Cockburn
snippet: Moffat was a very peculiar looking scoundrel, both in face and figure ; and had certainly a very strong personal resemblance to the murderer as described by the boys ; but, if I recollect right, this circumstance is not much founded on by Denovan.

title: Memorials of his time,
author: Cockburn, Henry Cockburn
snippet: About twenty years after this a police officer, called Denovan, an old High School fellow of mine and a clever man, published the life of James Moffat or Maccoul, a famous villain, who in 1820 was condemned to be hanged for robbing a bank, but died in prison.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns :
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Pass Dunipace, a place laid out with fine taste — a charming amphitheatre bounded by Denny village, and pleasant seats of Herbertshire, Denovan, and down to Dunipace.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " In the summer of 1815 and 1H16, I was employed to thinsome plantations for James Johnstone, Esq., of Alva, on hisestate of Denovan; and also in the same vears, for ThomasSpottiswoode, Esq. of Dunnipace.
